definition: to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: But Mr Hu risks causing ructions among other senior leaders.
sentences.chinese: 但是胡先生同样要冒着党内领导之间歧见得风险。

sentences.english: The White House played down any differences among Mr. Obama's advisers.
sentences.chinese: 白宫在尽量淡化奥巴马总统顾问之间的歧见。

sentences.english: The genesis of strike was a disagreement over wages.
sentences.chinese: 那次罢工的起源是因工资问题上的歧见。

sentences.english: The nations leagued against their common enemy.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须捐弃歧见，对付共同的敌人。

sentences.english: When clashing wills divide us, and hearts refuse to mend.
sentences.chinese: 当歧见把我们分开，众心拒绝复和。

sentences.english: Let us get rid of the fork to see and jointly works.
sentences.chinese: 让我们摒弃歧见而共同工作吧。

definition: each sticks to his own opinion (idiom); chacun son gout
to seek common ground, putting differences aside (idiom)
variant of 意識形態|意识形态[yi4 shi2 xing2 tai4]
to fail to meet each other/to conflict with each other/to be at odds with
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
